alert.note: Alert for Forrest; Lamar; Marion (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 11:33AM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Marion, southeastern Forrest and southern Lamar Counties through 1215 PM CST... At 1133 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Baxterville, or 11 miles east of Sandy Hook, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Lumberton around 1140 AM CST. Purvis around 1145 AM CST. Rock Hill around 1150 AM CST. Mclaurin and Brooklyn around 1200 PM CST. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CST for south central and southeastern Mississippi.
